title: Hey! | Galen Xing
main_content: Hey! My name is Galen (pronounced gallon, like, a Galen of Water). I’m currently a software engineer @ CZBiohub working with Nir Yosef on generative models for single cell genomics. I graduated Columbia University with a Dual Degree in CS and Statistics. I’m passionate about machine learning and computational biology. Previously: Work: Built models for robotic motion planning @ Samsung AI Center-NY Built models and pipelines for the microbiome @ Prime Discoveries Built deep learning models for GDPR compliance @ IBM Built multi-task neural networks for drug discovery @ Schrödinger Research: Worked on scRNA-seq spatial autocorrelation with Prof. Dana Peer Classified opiate addiction patients with Prof. Sean Luo Presented at ML in Healthcare Workshop at NIPS 2016 MRSA research with Prof. Paul Planet Publications: scvi-tools: a library for deep probabilistic analysis of single-cell omics data Gayoso A*, Lopez R*, Xing G *, Boyeau P, Wu K, Jayasuriya M, Melhman E, Langevin M, Liu Y, Samaran J, Misrachi G, Nazaret A, Clivio O, Xu C, Ashuach T, Lotfollahi M, Svensson V, Beltrame E, Talavera-Lopez C, Pachter L, Theis F, Streets A, Jordan M, Regier J, Yosef N. (first three authors contributed equally) bioRxiv , 2021. [Paper] Parallel Epidemics of Community-Associated Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus USA300 in North and South America Planet PJ, Diaz L, Kolokotronis SO, Narechania A, Reyes J, Xing G , Rincon S, Smith H, Panesso D, Ryan C, Smith DP, Guzman M, Zurita J, Sebra R, Deikus G, Nolan RL, Tenover FC, Weinstock GM, Robinson DA, Arias CA. Journal of Infectious Diseases , 2015. [Paper] Transferable vancomycin resistance in a community-associated MRSA lineage Rossi F, Diaz L, Wollam A, Panesso D, Zhou Y, Rincon S, Narechania A, Xing G , Di Gioia TS, Doi A, Tran TT, Reyes J, Munita JM, Carvajal LP, Hernandez-Roldan A, Brandão D, van der Heijden IM, Murray BE, Planet PJ, Weinstock GM, Arias CA. New England Journal of Medicine , 2014. [Paper] Contact: Hit me up if you wanna learn more, collaborate, or grab a beer! gx2113 (at) columbia (dot) edu
